Stick to facts not fantasy.

author: undying1200
content: Since we are on Ethereum discord, Ethereum was never ever meant to be mined in large farms. If you read the yellow paper it was agaist ASICs and the centralization of mining. I see it as a failure on the development side to not make algo changes as needed to keep the intended state so small miners could be the primary miner. If this were true there would be very little farms which would not be an issue for locating them by oppressive governments. So POW only misses meeting your goals because it failed at living up to POW goals it made in the yellowpaper.

author: 0xsadcat
content: you can't just take the percentage of energy that comes from renewables in the location and assume mining uses it in the same proportion. this may be true for hydro which is somewhat stable, but the sun doesn't shine at night and mining is a 24/7 activity, shutting down every night would destroy the roi. mining is the worst possible energy demand pattern for renewables - constant baseload. its only advantage over other demand sources is that it can be in remote locations.
